Text: i really hope these arent just mp3 converts, you've ul'd alot the past few days...

1977, 1980, 1982 is a High Definition Audio, from DVD Audio discs in 24/192 format. All other from "traditional" Audio CDs:

http://losslessclub.com/details.php?id=3367
http://losslessclub.com/details.php?id=4506
http://losslessclub.com/details.php?id=5478
I seem to be short a codec. What do I play or burn these HD audio files with? they are not ordinary flac

This is a ordinary FLAC, but in high resolution:

rain@acnote:/mnt/music/flac/The Alan Parsons Project/1977 - I Robot$ metaflac --list 01\ -\ I\ Robot.flac | grep -E 'comment|vendor|sample_rate|channels|bits-per-sample'
  sample_rate: 192000 Hz
  channels: 2
  bits-per-sample: 24
  vendor string: reference libFLAC 1.2.1 20070917
  comments: 10
    comment[0]: TITLE=I Robot
    comment[1]: ARTIST=The Alan Parsons Project
    comment[2]: ALBUM=I Robot
    comment[3]: DATE=1977
    comment[4]: TRACKNUMBER=01
    comment[5]: TRACKTOTAL=10
    comment[6]: GENRE=Progressive Rock
    comment[7]: DESCRIPTION=2004 Release. Dvd Audio
    comment[8]: COMMENT=2004 Release. Dvd Audio
    comment[9]: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE_CHANNEL_MASK=0x0003


You can play it in any modern software player, like Audacious / MOCP / deadbeef or any other under Linux or in Foobar if your OS is Windows.
